Pytorch is heavily integrated with cuDNN (e.g. LSTM implementation)

Therefore, using the CTC loss function provided by cuDNN 7 should be OK, too. Also, it is probably heavily optimized and it will be actively maintained by the cuDNN team.

body:
Pytorch is heavily integrated with cuDNN (e.g. [LSTM implementation](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html?highlight=lstm#torch.nn.LSTM))

Therefore, using the CTC loss function provided by cuDNN 7 should be OK, too. Also, it is probably heavily optimized and it will be actively maintained by the cuDNN team.
